metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28493 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description: This affects the package jinja2 from 0.0.0 and before 2.11.3. The ReDoSvulnerability is mainly due to the `_punctuation_re regex` operator and itsuse of multiple wildcards. The last wildcard is the most exploitable as itsearches for trailing punctuation. This issue can be mitigated by Markdownto format user content instead of the urlize filter, or by implementingrequest timeouts and limiting process memory.

criterions.comment: jinja2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
